description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dgp2o","text":"This protocol details the process of generating nucleus segmentations in FIB-SEM (Focused Ion Beam Scanning Electron Microscopy) image stacks of cells and tissues using Cellpose. These segmentations are crucial for gaining biological insights and training deep learning models on cell and organelle segmentation. The protocol covers the application of Cellpose for fine-tuning 2D models specifically for nuclei segmentation. Once fine-tuned, the model is used to generate 3D predictions for the entire dataset. These segmentations can be further refined through manual approaches, utilized for visualization, or employed in training other machine learning models.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Image segmentation, nucleus, volume electron microscopy, cellpose

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"v1p1","text":"The purpose of this protocol is to provide comprehensive instructions on how to create nuclei segmentations in FIB-SEM datasets on OpenOrganelle.org using Cellpose. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":131,"length":17}],"data":{}},{"key":"69m88","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e12kt","text":"Cellpose is a generalist algorithm developed by Stringer et al., (2020) to segment cellular structures. Cellpose also provides software for manual segmentation and model training. In this protocol we discuss the use of Cellpose v3.0.9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":23}],"data":{}},{"key":"dll4c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ddcok","text":"OpenOrganelle.org is an online platform that provides access to {"blocks":[{"key":"3gfj2","text":"OpenOrganelle (Heinrich et al, 2021) is a collection of focused ion beam scanning electron microscopy (FIB-SEM) datasets curated by the Janelia CellMap Project Team. Each dataset on OpenOrganelle includes important background information about the sample, protocol, contributors, and more. The “VIEW” button opens a new tab to view the chosen dataset in Neuroglancer. Each dataset is also accompanied by a Fiji link which copies the location of the dataset in the S3 bucket (see Figure 1). This link was used to read data into Fiji and save as 2D slices for Cellpose. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":13},{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":20},{"key":2,"offset":136,"length":28},{"key":3,"offset":406,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"2m2hu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fl7v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6bq8i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lo7k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4a465","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4luoo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eip55","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"71936B86C514473D924F321F5DBBC401","url":"https://openorganelle.janelia.org"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0674E8204AC240709491E050693F162A","url":"https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-021-03977-3"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D1A48FF6F087445EA951356040FDB89B","url":"https://www.janelia.org/project-team/cellmap"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BC2C0643048C4B728A45D2A12585C536","url":"https://imagej.net"}},"4":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"448C02184F7711EF8FC10A58A9FEAC02","height":148,"id":488473,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9fn9\",\"text\":\"Figure 1: OpenOrganelle page. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7a1qg","text":"Navigate through the file container by clicking the dropdown, e.g.  “em”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85jrf","text":"Choose resolution, e.g., s0 (original), s1 (2x downsample), s3 (4x downsample), etc.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hfqk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crm0i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ej6n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85f3a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qh58","text":"This step involves reading the data from the S3 bucket into your local computer memory. The datasets can be very large; care should be taken when choosing which resolution to read. The approximate size of the image volume is listed e.g., \"s0 (12400x500x9382, int16 → 16-bit) (116.3 GB)\"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Using Fiji to save files in the cloud locally as 2D tiffs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"114hm","text":"Before closing the image in Fiji, save a second copy of the dataset as a 3D tiff. This will be used for generating 3D predictions in a later step in Cellpose. If the image is closed before creating the 3D tiff, you can simply drag the folder containing the image sequence into the main Fiji bar to open it. To save it as a 3D tiff: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"186oa","text":"File → Save As → Tiff ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aug5","text":"See Figure 4. tiff. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/gif","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"fig2.3.gif","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6wxbtirf.gif","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6wwbtirf.gif","width":550}},"1":{"type":"dataset","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"affiliation":null,"can_edit":true,"guid":"A95FCEFD4F8411EF8A820A58A9FEAC02","link":"https://openorganelle.janelia.org/datasets/jrc_mus-pancreas-1","name":"jrc_mus-pancreas-1"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7it67","text":"While creating annotations in Cellpose for model finetuning, it is helpful to keep the image volume open in Fiji as a reference. It is not always evident what an organelle is from just the 2D slices presented in Cellpose. To open the 3D tiff, drag the tiff file into the main Fiji menu. A scroll bar will appear at the bottom for viewing the entire stack. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1njk0","text":"To begin using Cellpose on the dataset, open the program (see Appendix). More detailed instructions for general Cellpose use can be found on https://cellpose.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gui.html. Within Cellpose go to: \nFile → Load Image → Select a slice for segmentation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":141,"length":50},{"style":"bold","offset":217,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":224,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":237,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":141,"length":50}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmqsc","text":"See {"blocks":[{"key":"2fsco","text":"Annotate the nuclei as accurately as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcqso","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7sote","text":"At first, it may be beneficial to use an existing model to make annotating easier. Out of the box, the cyto2_cp3 model tends to give promising results for nuclei in FIB-SEM volumes of tissue. If the model does not catch anything, try annotating a couple slices manually and training a model. Continue to use and improve the model by periodically adding more training slices. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":103,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":103,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77ape","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dgpg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1m1if","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tua5","text":" Refer to Figure 6 for what a completed slice might look like. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lrl6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t7js","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3kb0l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8orik","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aav7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9ludb","text":"Make sure to clean up missing spots, mistaken predictions, and tidy up the edges.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"07665F214F7F11EF8FC10A58A9FEAC02","height":460,"id":488475,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"adf8n\",\"text\":\"Figure 6: Example of a fully annotated slice from the dataset jrc_mus-kidney-2. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"fig3.2.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6w3btirf.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7a5btirf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6xibtirf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7a4btirf.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"dataset","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"affiliation":null,"can_edit":true,"guid":"75ECE8B04F7511EF8FC10A58A9FEAC02","link":"https://openorganelle.janelia.org/datasets/jrc_mus-kidney-2","name":"jrc_mus-kidney-2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jphi","text":"Once the annotation is complete, save the slice along with the masks.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap5om","text":"File → Save masks and image (as *_seg.npy) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15jn2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2coh6","text":"This file will automatically be saved into the folder where the rest of the 2D slices can be found. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tihv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95fkt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9mej2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7cro","text":"Do not change the name as this is how Cellpose will recognize that the file should be used for training. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnakc","text":"To train a model on annotated slices, go to: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2js24","text":"Models → Train new model with image+masks in folder ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8621k","text":"To run this model on a new 2D slice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ued4","text":"Set the initial model to cyto2_cp3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jt18","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2frs","text":"Adjust n_epochs to change the number of epochs (we generally went with 1000)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":7,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19g16","text":"Name the model for organizational purposes. Click “OK” and wait for the training to finish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68ecn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rsrc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cejmr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"378dh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"28n7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"nedd","text":"We found that training took at most 15 minutes and the largest amount of training slices required for an adequate model was 38 slices. Progress can be tracked in the terminal (See Figure 7). The model’s file will automatically be created in a separate “models” folder that is placed inside the folder that contains the 2D slices.  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"E34376234F7F11EF8A820A58A9FEAC02","height":317,"id":488477,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"f875c\",\"text\":\"Figure 7. Screenshot of the terminal while training is in progress. The number after “[INFO]” displays the current epoch. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"fig3.3.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6w5btirf.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7a7btirf.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7a6btirf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fp6u5","text":"Open the blank 2D slice and locate the section labeled “Other models” on the left-hand side of the program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8klti","text":"Open the dropdown for custom models, select the new model, and click run. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"867oi","text":"Repeat this process, making use of previous models, annotating additional slices until the model performs satisfactorily on 2D slices.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fitet","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"t6mv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E7CB4576F3B5405BB2E89620D7ECE4AA","step_guid":"B155345696AA466D912D712EC9221C75","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmfdl","text":"Cellpose can extend models that were trained exclusively on 2D data to perform predictions in 3D. Once the model demonstrates a satisfactory performance in 2D, we attempt to run a prediction in 3D.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3oirf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anf7j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a7kcr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2fr9t","text":"In Cellpose v3.0.9, to create a 3D prediction, the program requires explicitly instructing the program to handle 3D data via a specific flag. This adjustment ensures that Cellpose interprets and processes the volumetric data correctly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7hvic","text":"Close Cellpose ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"98lpu","text":"Into the terminal enter:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dae01","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faf2f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4q6b8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k4vf","text":"This will alert Cellpose to load data as 3D ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"86cvh","text":"python -m cellpose --Zstack","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1uh04","text":"Now load in the previously saved 3D volume by: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq089","text":"File → Load Image → Select the tiff file ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1iq8p","text":"Once the tiff has loaded, run the custom model as described for 2D in Step 15.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"120lq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl3lh","text":"This may take a while (on the order of tens of minutes) and progress can be tracked in the terminal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds4ub","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acp24","text":"The process will be complete when the masks are visible (see Figure 8).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0voj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oqd8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"73jtu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q146","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69fgs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1n69","text":"The terminal will also contain how many masks were found at the end of the run (see Figure 9).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tivj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bn67","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6kmn0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"39C6EE574F8211EF8A820A58A9FEAC02","height":454,"id":488092,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"eop54\",\"text\":\"Figure 8: A finetuned Cellpose model has been applied to the dataset jrc_mus-kidney-2.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/gif","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"fig4.1.gif","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6w7btirf.gif","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6w6btirf.gif","width":550}},"1":{"type":"dataset","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"affiliation":null,"can_edit":true,"guid":"75ECE8B04F7511EF8FC10A58A9FEAC02","link":"https://openorganelle.janelia.org/datasets/jrc_mus-kidney-2","name":"jrc_mus-kidney-2"}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"5BF8B7654F8211EF8A820A58A9FEAC02","height":409,"id":488479,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"2kion\",\"text\":\"Figure 9: Screenshot of the terminal after Cellpose ran a 3D prediction. The arrow points to where the terminal lists out how many masks were found. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"4.2.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q6w9btirf.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7a9btirf.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7a8btirf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqag0","text":"To save the masks go to: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fvms","text":"File → Save masks as PNG/tiff ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddblv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9us6b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsh8d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"81v67","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"A3D6E477502311EF81B20A58A9FEAC02","height":162,"id":488481,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"3u7i\",\"text\":\"Figure 10: Example results of Cellpose segmentations from three datasets. Shown are 3D renderings of the segmentations that have been manually proofread.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"nucleus-results.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q69qbtirf.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7bbbtirf.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q7babtirf.webp","width":550}}}}
